page.title: 20Local Issues-Gotherington
page.content: There are three local issues of particular importance in Gotherington. Firstly, there is the issue of new building developments in the village. Building regulations state that the houses must be made out of cotswold stone type brick and must be counted as infilling because the village is not allowed to get bigger in area. Secondly, there are no street lights. This is because the Parish Council held a vote and most people voted not to have them partly because it puts more money on the rates. Thirdly, some trees are important in the village and have a preservation order on them and that means the trees can't be cut because they are considered as special trees. Up on Nottingham Hill there is a new wood planted a year ago. They are destined to replace a lot of diseased elms.
